Issues.Title: Angular 8 - How to dynamically add children routes coming from a service to a parent routing module
Issues.Body:
I'm using Angular 8. I have some modules, for instance client-migration.module.ts , which are being lazily loaded in app-routing.module ts. 
In the parent component routing module, client-migration-routing.module.ts , I need to load the children routes that are coming from a service (the components are already created) . How can I achieve this? I already asked everywhere and I'm here since this is almost my last resort. Hope somebody can help :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular 8 - How to dynamically add children routes coming from a service to a parent routing module " (#38989)

Issues.Title: i18n ID generation should ignore inner HTML tag attributes and interpolation content
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
- @angular/core
- i18n

### Description
Let's imagine the following snippet:
```html
<button i18n="...">
  <icon value="notebook"></icon>
  Edit {{ 1 + 1 // i18n(ph="number") }}
</button>
```

The generated message would _look like_:
`[ICON_TAG_START][ICON_TAG_END] Edit [NUMBER]`

Therefore if I modify the icon `value` to say... "pencil", I expect my localization not to be affected, however at this time, Angular i18n considers _all_ the inner HTML contents to generate, this means that `<icon value="notebook"></icon>` is used to generate the ID when it doesn't actually (in most cases) affect localization.

_The same is true for interpolation._ For example, If I change `{{ 1 + 1 // i18n(ph="number") }}` to `{{1+1 // i18n(ph="number")}}`, where the contents didn't even change semantics, the whitespaces just got removed.

**Note:**
This is slightly related to the Issue about whitespaces such as indentation affecting localization
Issue: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/13114

### Describe the solution you'd like
As stated above, I would like that Angular would generate the localization ID based of a normalized string instead of the inner HTML.

The normalized string would mean:
- whitespace is normalized (unrelated to this report, but still important)
- transform inner HTML tags into the respective placeholder (e.g. `<icon></icon>` -> `[ICON_START][ICON_END]`)
- transform interpolation to the respective placeholders (e.g. `{{ 1 + 1 }}` -> `[INTERPOLATION]`)

**And then** generate the ID based off this:
`[ICON_TAG_START][ICON_TAG_END] Edit [NUMBER]`

Not based of the inner HTML character by character.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Sometimes it's possible to alleviate these issues with `<ng-container>` such as:
```html
<button>
  <icon value="notebook"></icon>
  <ng-container i18n="...">Edit {{ 1 + 1 // i18n(ph="number") }}</ng-container>
</button>
```
However this is not always ideal because some non-English languages may change meaning slightly based on this difference.

For example this is **not** localization-friendly:
```html
<button>
  <icon value="notebook"></icon>
  <ng-container i18n="...">Edit</ng-container> {{ 1 + 1 // i18n(ph="number") }}
</button>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n ID generation should ignore inner HTML tag attributes and interpolation content" (#38980)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): iteratively parse interpolations
Issues.Body:
This patch refactors the interpolation parser to do so iteratively
rather than using a regex. Doing so prepares us for supporting granular
recovery on poorly-formed interpolations, for example when an
interpolation does not terminate (`{{ 1 + 2`) or is not terminated
properly (`{{ 1 + 2 {{ 2 + 3 }}`).

Part of #38596

Issues.Title: ContentChildren query lags in change detection when wrapped by template
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core probably ### Is this a regression? No, the issue was present at least since version 7 ### Description When your component has `ng-template` in its content for later instantiation and inside that template there's a list of items ‚Äî you can query those children with `ContentChildren` once you instantiate the template. However change detection in them lags a cycle. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-content-children-query-bug ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
10
**Anything else relevant?** In the reproduction Stackblitz, type a short string into input. This string is then broken into chars and spread into a list of DIVs with a 2 seconds delay. You can even see that "content checked" is printed to console when the list updates. However the `QueryList` of children is not refreshed. Also note that I had to wrap `setInterval` into `runOutsideAngular`. Otherwise it would create a tick that refreshes the query, even though both components are `OnPush`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ContentChildren query lags in change detection when wrapped by template" (#38976)

Issues.Title: Losing `@types/*` packages types on second+ server rebuild
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.x ### Description Somehow typescript loses `@types/*` types on second+ angular app rebuild. It works fine on devserver start, first rebuild and on build command. We faced this for `require` and some webpack typings in our apps after update ng9 -> ng10. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - clone https://github.com/artaommahe/angular-cli-missing-types-on-rebuild - open app.component.ts - start dev server - no errors - trigger rebuild (e.g. add comment) - no errors - trigger second rebuild - see type error Adding `types: ['node']` solves `require` type error, but you need to add all `@types/*` packages for big projects. `@types/*` should work fine without any additional actions. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Unit test doesn't fail even if TypeError is thrown during cleanup
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package **@angular/core** ### Is this a regression? Not sure but it's a problem since at least Angular 8. ### Description Suppose you have an application with a component that implements the `ngOnDestroy` method: `ngOnDestroy(): void { console.log(this.foo.bar); }` Also, suppose that `this.foo === undefined` when `ngOnDestroy` is called during the execution of the unit tests. It will logically output a TypeError. The problem is that the test that logs this error **does not fail**. There is obviously something that went wrong during the cleanup of the component, I would expect my test to fail. The problem is that such errors are catched but nothing is done with them apart from logging the error: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/testing/src/test_bed.ts#L336 Is this behaviour expected? If so is there another way to fail the test when such an error is thrown? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction See the following repo: https://github.com/bertrandE/app-repro Just run `ng test` in order to reproduce. ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR: 'Error during cleanup of component', Object{component: AppComponent{title: 'app-repro', __ngContext__: [...]}, stacktrace: TypeError: Cannot read property 'bar' of undefined
TypeError: Cannot read property 'bar' of undefined
    at AppComponent.ngOnDestroy (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/src/app/app.component.ts:15:26)
    at executeOnDestroys (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/core.js:9070:1)
    at cleanUpView (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/core.js:8992:1)
    at destroyViewTree (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/core.js:8801:1)
    at destroyLView (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/core.js:8945:1)
    at RootViewRef.destroy (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/core.js:9679:1)
    at ComponentRef$1.destroy (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/core.js:22234:1)
    at ComponentFixture.destroy (http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/testing.js:330:1)
    at http://localhost:9876/_karma_webpack_/node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/testing.js:2052:1
    at Array.forEach ()}

Issues.Title: Angular Element DOM node is removed from DOM when an Angular Element is readded/reconnected
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/animations

### Is this a regression?
No

### Description

As described by @kseamon in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/38778#issuecomment-690715758, when an Angular Element is removed from the DOM then later re-added, the animation engine removes the custom element which destroys the component again. Thereby, it's impossible to re-add an Angular Element to the DOM without first destroying the element yourself.

Here's a screenshot of the stacktrace. You can see it goes straight from initializing the component on connect to disconnecting it after running `detectChanges`.

![disconnect-upon-reconnect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1170843/94060331-a3039a00-fd98-11ea-9298-cc246f1ab219.png)

I have a fix in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/38816 that creates a new div as a child of the custom element and the new div is then destroyed on connect.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Interestingly enough, I'm not able to reproduce with a minimal example on stackblitz. I have an example set up that invokes `scheduledDestroyFn` and then sets it to null explicitly when destroying the element but the element is re-added correctly. https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ovchwr-x1cnsi?file=src%2Fmain.ts Perhaps, it has to do with the size and complexity of the app.

## üî• Exception or Error

No error but the Angular Element is removed immediately upon reconnect.

## üåç  Your Environment

Latest Angular (I'm a Google engineer working within google3).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Element DOM node is removed from DOM when an Angular Element is readded/reconnected" (#38962)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support package references in styles & scripts options
Issues.Body:
The browser builder's `styles` and `scripts` options now support using a package name in the path when specifying a style or script.  This removes the need to use a relative path to the node modules directory in these options.  This provides support for Yarn PnP as well as reducing the complexity of the options especially for monorepo setups.  Relatively located files will take precedence over packages if they exist.  This precedence provides backwards compatibility with existing configurations.

Before :
`"styles": ["../node_modules/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.css"]`

After:
`"styles": ["bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.css"]`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support package references in styles & scripts options" (#18879)

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [x] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
The command `ng serve` currently does not generate service worker files.
It may be because in the past it was not possible to register service workers in non SSL sites.
There is now a exception to that, all `http://localhost` or `http://127.x.y.z` addresses do work (at least in Chrome)
This was already shortly discussed in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16883#issuecomment-650178791 but only the generation for `ng build --watch` was implemented.
`ng serve` & serve-ssr do not generate these files.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
Generate the needed service worker files in `@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server` & `@nguniversal/builders:ssr-dev-server`

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Build the universal server & run that without serve-ssr, which is really cumbersome in development

Issues.Title: Lazy-loaded circular dependent components break live-reload
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.x ### Description In a specific scenario, changes to component code (template, styles, ts) result in erroneous js and an exception in the browser: `ReferenceError: Cannot access 'AComponent' before initialization`. In another scenario, a component stops rendering right after a given change in the template. See video for details. This happens in the following scenario: * Routing is used * Affected components are lazy-loaded * Components are circular dependent, i.e. imaine a tree-like data-structure, where nodes have child-nodes of the same type * Components are not directly but indirectly nested: a -> b -> c -> a -> b -> c -> a Changing _anything_ (e.g. a color in the styles) bricks the live-reloaded app. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Repo: https://github.com/scheja/repro-app (Basic app, generated with `ng new --routing`) Start with `ng serve`, go to `http://localhost:4200/lazy`, then start editing e.g. `src/app/lazy/c/c.component.html` and watch what happens. Quick screen recording: https://youtu.be/d7Ch0pEPtNQ ## üî• Exception or Error ReferenceError: Cannot access 'AComponent' before initialization ## üåç Your Environment 
Angular CLI: 10.1.3
Node: 14.10.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.1.3
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1001.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1001.3
@angular-devkit/core            10.1.3
@angular-devkit/schematics      10.1.3
@schematics/angular             10.1.3
@schematics/update              0.1001.3
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.3
**Anything else relevant?** Related to: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/18183 (this might be the need: repro steps)

Issues.Title: Bug: ng xi18n --ivy does not extract i18n tokens from libraries
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [x] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? This works with `ng xi18n` ### Description `ng xi18n --ivy` does not extract i18n tokens from libraries, whereas `ng xi18n` is able to extract it from libraries compiled with ViewEngine. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/kyubisation/xi18n-ivy-library-viewengine Run `npm ci && npm test` (which build the ViewEngine and Ivy libraries and runs xi18n) and check messages.xlf ## üåç Your Environment

### [`v11.0.0-next.3`](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1100-next3-2020-09-23)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/compare/11.0.0-next.2...11.0.0-next.3)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **common:** add `params` and `reportProgress` options to `HttpClient.put()` overload ([#​37873](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37873)) ([dd8d8c8](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/dd8d8c8)), closes [#​23600](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/23600)
-   **compiler-cli:** generate `let` statements in ES2015+ mode ([#​38775](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38775)) ([123bff7](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/123bff7))
-   **core:** ensure TestBed is not instantiated before override provider ([#​38717](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38717)) ([c8f056b](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/c8f056b))
-   **forms:** type NG_VALUE_ACCESSOR injection token as array ([#​29723](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/29723)) ([2b1b718](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/2b1b718)), closes [#​29351](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/29351)

##### Features

-   **common:** Add ISO week-numbering year formats support to formatDate ([#​38828](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38828)) ([984ed39](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/984ed39))
-   **compiler:** Parse and recover on incomplete opening HTML tags ([#​38681](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38681)) ([6ae3b68](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/6ae3b68)), closes [#​38596](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38596)
-   **router:** add migration to update calls to navigateByUrl and createUrlTree with invalid parameters ([#​38825](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38825)) ([7849fdd](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/7849fdd)), closes [#​38227](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38227)
-   **service-worker:** add the option to prefer network for navigation requests ([#​38565](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38565)) ([a206852](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/a206852)), closes [#​38194](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38194)

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **core:** If you call `TestBed.overrideProvider` after TestBed initialization, provider overrides are not applied. This
    behavior is consistent with other override methods (such as `TestBed.overrideDirective`, etc) but they
    throw an error to indicate that, when the check was missing in the `TestBed.overrideProvider` function.
    Now calling `TestBed.overrideProvider` after TestBed initialization also triggers an
    error, thus there is a chance that some tests (where `TestBed.overrideProvider` is
    called after TestBed initialization) will start to fail and require updates to move `TestBed.overrideProvider` calls
    before TestBed initialization is completed.

-   **ngcc:** fix compilation of `ChangeDetectorRef` in pipe constructors ([#​38892](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38892)) ([093c3a1](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/093c3a1)), closes [#​38666](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38666) [#​38883](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38883)

Issues.Title: Add i18n locales for different languages dynamically in angular.json
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/cli


### Description
I would like to add multiple XLF translation files as much as I need in: `/assets/i18n` folder based on the languages I want to support. But I don't want to be forced to edit `angular.json` file and add the specific path for these languages manually in `angular.json`. The path for those files should be added dynamically to `angular.json`.
```
"i18n": {
     "locales": {
           "en": "src/assets/i18n/messages.en.xlf",
            "it": "src/assets/i18n/messages.it.xlf",
            "es": "src/assets/i18n/messages.es.xlf",
            "xx": "src/assets/i18n/messages.xx.xlf",
            "xx": "src/assets/i18n/messages.xx.xlf",
            ...,
            ...
    }
}
```

### Describe the solution you'd like
May be a kind of property in env file (An array of objects - Key/value pair as language and its path) 


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Same as in the description

Have been searching but unfortunately didn't find any significant solution or hint. Thanks!

Issues.Title: build: update postcss to version 8.0.9
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | dependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.9`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.9) | | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | devDependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.9`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.9) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/postcss ### [`v8.0.9`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​809) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.8...8.0.9) - Replace prototype in PostCSS 7 nodes instead of recreating them. - Added missed `Transformer` to exported types (by Pierre-Marie Dartus). ### [`v8.0.8`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​808) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.7...8.0.8) - Fix `8.0.7` regression on PostCSS 7 nodes converting (by Adam Wathan). ### [`v8.0.7`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​807) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.6...8.0.7) - Fixed compatibility issue with mixin AST with PostCSS 7 and 8 nodes. - Added migration guide translation to Chinese to the warning. ### [`v8.0.6`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​806) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.5...8.0.6) - Fixed child adding methods in `Container`. ### [`v8.0.5`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​805) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.4...8.0.5) - Update changelog. ### [`v8.0.4`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​804) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.3...8.0.4) - Fixed `Cannot read property 'line' of null` error. - Fixed source map support for declarations. ### [`v8.0.3`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​803) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.2...8.0.3) - Fixed client-side bundling support. ### [`v8.0.2`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​802) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.1...8.0.2) - Fixed plugin packs support. ### [`v8.0.1`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​801) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.0...8.0.1) - Updated `Processor#version`. ### [`v8.0.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/releases/8.0.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.34...8.0.0) PostCSS 8.0 brings new plugin API, `node_modules` size reduction, better source map support, and CSS parser improvements. Check out [a day-by-day diary](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936) of PostCSS 8.0 development process. #### Thanks to Sponsors With more than [100 M downloads per month](https://npm-stat.com/charts.html?package=postcss), it becomes hard to support PostCSS in free time. For instance, getting the 8.0 release ready took [4 months of work](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936). This release was possible thanks to out community. [**Tailwind CSS**](https://tailwindcss.com/), [**De Voorhoede**](https://www.voorhoede.nl/en/), [**InVision AG**](https://www.ivx.com/), [**Brainbow**](https://opencollective.com/brnbw), and [many individual contributions](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). If your company wants to support the sustainability of front-end infrastructure or just wants to give some love to PostCSS, you can join our supporters by: - [**Tidelift**](https://tidelift.com/) with a Spotify-like subscription model and supporting all projects from your lock file. - Direct donations in [**PostCSS & Autoprefixer Open Collective**](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). #### Breaking Changes We try to avoid any breaking changes for end-users: - PostCSS 8 dropped **Node.js 6.x, 8.x, 11.x, and 13.x** versions support. All these versions have no security updates anymore. - We now serve ES6+ sources in the npm package **without Babel** compilation. If you are creating tools like CodePen and put PostCSS into the client-side JS bundle, you may need to run Babel on `node_modules/postcss` for old browsers. - We removed rarely used `postcss.vendor` API. #### New Plugin API The biggest change in PostCSS 8 is a new plugin API. Thanks to [@​BondarenkoAlex](https://togithub.com/BondarenkoAlex) for big help in creating a new API. ```js module.exports = () => { return { postcssPlugin: 'postcss-will-change', Declaration: { 'will-change': (decl, { Declaration }) => { decl.cloneBefore( new Declaration({ prop: 'backface-visibility', value: 'hidden' }) ) } } } } module.exports.postcss = true ``` We know that rewriting old plugins will take time, but the new API will improve the end-user‚Äôs experience and make life easier for plugin developers: - With new API, all plugins can share a single scan of the CSS tree. It makes CSS processing up to **20% faster**. - Because npm often duplicates dependencies, you may have many `postcss` duplicates in your `node_modules`. New API fixes this problem. - Plugins will re-visit changed nodes to **reduce compatibility issues** between plugins. Now the order of plugins in your PostCSS config will be less important. - New API is close to Babel‚Äôs visitor API. These resources will help plugin developers in API migration: - [**The Migration Guide**](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/postcss-8-plugin-migration) - [**Writing a PostCSS Plugin**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/docs/writing-a-plugin.md) - We have a [**Gitter chat**](https://gitter.im/postcss/postcss) open for all questions related to plugin migration. PostCSS development guidelines were also changed: - Now it is prohibited to create own AST on top of PostCSS AST classes since it could lead to [painful bugs](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1305) due to the usage private APIs. - Plugins and runners must have `postcss` in `peerDependencies`. #### New Website without React Previously PostCSS used [a React-based framework](https://togithub.com/phenomic/phenomic) for the project's website. Since we have a static website, we decided to migrate to a React-free framework and got good performance improvements: - **360 ‚Üí 20** ms for Max Potential First Input Delay - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for First CPU Idle - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for Time to Interactive Check out [**postcss.org**](https://postcss.org/) and [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/) that feature the awesome alchemy-inspired design by [@​okonet](https://togithub.com/okonet). We also removed Google Analytics tracking scripts and encourage other open source projects to be an example in caring about user‚Äôs privacy and performance. #### Parser Improvments Did you know that all examples below are valid CSS? ```css :root { --empty: ; --JSON: [1, "2", {"three": {"a":1}}, [4]]; --javascript: function(rule) { console.log(rule) }; } @​supports (--element(".minwidth", { "minWidth": 300 })) { [--self] { background: greenyellow; } } ``` Now PostCSS parses even those rare edge cases correctly. Thanks to Tailwind CSS and Prettier teams for adding more cases to our [CSS parser tests collection](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss-parser-tests/). Note that now `--roundMixin: { border-radius: 8px }` will be parsed as a `Declaration` with the `{ border-radius: 8px }` value. #### Better Source Map Support We have added support for two new source map formats: [**Index map**](https://sourcemaps.info/spec.html#h.535es3xeprgt) and [**JSON**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1371) (`data:application/json`). PostCSS 8 is now much closer to the source map spec. Thanks to the Google team for reports: - We now [treat](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1347) `sources` in map **as URLs** instead of file paths. - We now [resolve](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1348) `sources` **relative to map file**, not CSS file. A few source map APIs were added: - `opts.maps.absolute = true` option for [absolute paths](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1352) in source map. - `opts.maps.annotation = (file, root) => url` for a [dynamic path](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1324) to source map. - `Node#origin()` now returns `position.url` in addition to `position.file` for compatibility with absolute URLs in source map‚Äôs `sources`. #### API Changes We have added **ES modules** support and now we **export all classes** from the main entry: ```js import { CssSyntaxError, parse } from "postcss" ``` [@​graberzz](https://togithub.com/graberzz) added [`Node#source.offset`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1325) in addition to `line` and `column`. CSS Custom Properties and Sass-like `$`-variables now have a special `Declaration#variable` mark: ```js const root = parse(` :root { --propery: value; } $variable: value `) root.first.first.variable //=> true root.last.variable //=> true ``` #### TypeScript PostCSS now has a first-class TypeScript support: - We moved API docs from JSDoc to [**TypeDoc**](https://typedoc.org/). Check out our [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/). - We are using [**check-dts**](https://togithub.com/ai/check-dts) to test types with [special unit tests](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/test/errors.ts). - We keep types in separate files for better readability. - With the new structure and test system, we fixed many small issues in types. #### Other Changes - [Fixed calling `replaceWith`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1368) with input replaced node (by [@​josephkaptur](https://togithub.com/josephkaptur)). - Reduce dependencies by replacing `chalk` to [`colorette`](https://togithub.com/jorgebucaran/colorette). - Added `Declaration#value` [auto-conversion](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1373) to string to prevent plugin‚Äôs bugs. - Fixed building PostCSS with Rollup (by [@​MapGrid](https://togithub.com/MapGrid)) because of [circular dependencies](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1321). - Moved unknown source from counter to random IDs: `:10:6`. - Removed docs from the npm package. ### [`v7.0.34`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​7034) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.33...7.0.34) - Fix compatibility with `postcss-scss` 2. ### [`v7.0.33`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​7033) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.32...7.0.33) - Add error message for PostCSS 8 plugins.

Issues.Title: No tsconfig.base.json in newly created projects
Issues.Body:
Hi there! Today I tried to update some projects to angular 10.x. Unfortunately it did not work at all, because I always run into the issue mentioned in #18130 To investigate the issue and get an idea I tried to create a completely new project using `ng new`. Surprisingly a newly created project also does not include a `tsconfig.base.json` file. # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Don't know. ### Description Newly created project does not include `tsconfig.base.json` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I started from scratch with a newly installed node 12.18.4 (with `nvm`) without any global module installed. Then I installed `@angular/cli` via 
npm i -g @angular/cli
Next, I created new project with CLI: 
ng new test --routing --style scss
I project gets created without errors. It contains `tsconfig.app.json`, `tsconfig.json` and `tsconfig.spec.json`, but no `tsconfig.base.json`. ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 10.1.2
Node: 12.18.4
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 
... 
Ivy Workspace: 

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1001.2 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         10.1.2 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   10.1.2 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          10.1.2 (cli-only)
@schematics/update           0.1001.2 (cli-only)

Issues.Title: Importing styles with inline loaders leads to commonjs dependencies warning
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: ng9 ### Description Import e.g. some global styles via inline loaders in component's file ```ts import '!style-loader!css-loader!./some-global-styles.css'; ``` start server or build and see a commonjs dependencies usage warning ``` WARNING in D:\projects\issues\angular-cli-styles-require-common-js-warning\src\app\app.component.ts depends on '!style-loader!css-loader!./some-global-styles.css'. CommonJS or AMD dependencies can cause optimization bailouts. For more info see: https://angular.io/guide/build#configuring-commonjs-dependencies ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - clone https://github.com/artaommahe/angular-cli-styles-require-common-js-warning - run server `yarn start` - see warning ## üî• Exception or Error

For more info see: https://angular.io/guide/build#configuring-commonjs-dependencies

Issues.Title: build: update postcss to version 8.0.8
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | dependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.8`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.8) | | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | devDependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.8`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.8) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/postcss ### [`v8.0.8`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​808) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.7...8.0.8) - Fix `8.0.7` regression on PostCSS 7 nodes converting (by Adam Wathan). ### [`v8.0.7`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​807) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.6...8.0.7) - Fixed compatibility issue with mixin AST with PostCSS 7 and 8 nodes. - Added migration guide translation to Chinese to the warning. ### [`v8.0.6`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​806) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.5...8.0.6) - Fixed child adding methods in `Container`. ### [`v8.0.5`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​805) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.4...8.0.5) - Update changelog. ### [`v8.0.4`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​804) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.3...8.0.4) - Fixed `Cannot read property 'line' of null` error. - Fixed source map support for declarations. ### [`v8.0.3`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​803) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.2...8.0.3) - Fixed client-side bundling support. ### [`v8.0.2`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​802) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.1...8.0.2) - Fixed plugin packs support. ### [`v8.0.1`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​801) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.0...8.0.1) - Updated `Processor#version`. ### [`v8.0.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/releases/8.0.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.34...8.0.0) PostCSS 8.0 brings new plugin API, `node_modules` size reduction, better source map support, and CSS parser improvements. Check out [a day-by-day diary](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936) of PostCSS 8.0 development process. #### Known Issues - `postcss-cli` need to be updated PostCSS to run new plugins - `gulp-postcss` need to be updated PostCSS to run new plugins - `postcss-load-plugins` (used by some environments) can‚Äôt load new plugins #### Thanks to Sponsors With more than [100 M downloads per month](https://npm-stat.com/charts.html?package=postcss), it becomes hard to support PostCSS in free time. For instance, getting the 8.0 release ready took [4 months of work](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936). This release was possible thanks to out community. [**Tailwind CSS**](https://tailwindcss.com/), [**De Voorhoede**](https://www.voorhoede.nl/en/), [**InVision AG**](https://www.ivx.com/), [**Brainbow**](https://opencollective.com/brnbw), and [many individual contributions](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). If your company wants to support the sustainability of front-end infrastructure or just wants to give some love to PostCSS, you can join our supporters by: - [**Tidelift**](https://tidelift.com/) with a Spotify-like subscription model and supporting all projects from your lock file. - Direct donations in [**PostCSS & Autoprefixer Open Collective**](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). #### Breaking Changes We try to avoid any breaking changes for end-users: - PostCSS 8 dropped **Node.js 6.x, 8.x, 11.x, and 13.x** versions support. All these versions have no security updates anymore. - We now serve ES6+ sources in the npm package **without Babel** compilation. If you are creating tools like CodePen and put PostCSS into the client-side JS bundle, you may need to run Babel on `node_modules/postcss` for old browsers. - We removed rarely used `postcss.vendor` API. #### New Plugin API The biggest change in PostCSS 8 is a new plugin API. Thanks to [@​BondarenkoAlex](https://togithub.com/BondarenkoAlex) for big help in creating a new API. ```js module.exports = () => { return { postcssPlugin: 'postcss-will-change', Declaration: { 'will-change': (decl, { Declaration }) => { decl.cloneBefore( new Declaration({ prop: 'backface-visibility', value: 'hidden' }) ) } } } } module.exports.postcss = true ``` We know that rewriting old plugins will take time, but the new API will improve the end-user‚Äôs experience and make life easier for plugin developers: - With new API, all plugins can share a single scan of the CSS tree. It makes CSS processing up to **20% faster**. - Because npm often duplicates dependencies, you may have many `postcss` duplicates in your `node_modules`. New API fixes this problem. - Plugins will re-visit changed nodes to **reduce compatibility issues** between plugins. Now the order of plugins in your PostCSS config will be less important. - New API is close to Babel‚Äôs visitor API. These resources will help plugin developers in API migration: - [**The Migration Guide**](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/postcss-8-plugin-migration) - [**Writing a PostCSS Plugin**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/docs/writing-a-plugin.md) - We have a [**Gitter chat**](https://gitter.im/postcss/postcss) open for all questions related to plugin migration. PostCSS development guidelines were also changed: - Now it is prohibited to create own AST on top of PostCSS AST classes since it could lead to [painful bugs](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1305) due to the usage private APIs. - Plugins and runners must have `postcss` in `peerDependencies`. #### New Website without React Previously PostCSS used [a React-based framework](https://togithub.com/phenomic/phenomic) for the project's website. Since we have a static website, we decided to migrate to a React-free framework and got good performance improvements: - **360 ‚Üí 20** ms for Max Potential First Input Delay - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for First CPU Idle - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for Time to Interactive Check out [**postcss.org**](https://postcss.org/) and [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/) that feature the awesome alchemy-inspired design by [@​okonet](https://togithub.com/okonet). We also removed Google Analytics tracking scripts and encourage other open source projects to be an example in caring about user‚Äôs privacy and performance. #### Parser Improvments Did you know that all examples below are valid CSS? ```css :root { --empty: ; --JSON: [1, "2", {"three": {"a":1}}, [4]]; --javascript: function(rule) { console.log(rule) }; } @​supports (--element(".minwidth", { "minWidth": 300 })) { [--self] { background: greenyellow; } } ``` Now PostCSS parses even those rare edge cases correctly. Thanks to Tailwind CSS and Prettier teams for adding more cases to our [CSS parser tests collection](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss-parser-tests/). Note that now `--roundMixin: { border-radius: 8px }` will be parsed as a `Declaration` with the `{ border-radius: 8px }` value. #### Better Source Map Support We have added support for two new source map formats: [**Index map**](https://sourcemaps.info/spec.html#h.535es3xeprgt) and [**JSON**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1371) (`data:application/json`). PostCSS 8 is now much closer to the source map spec. Thanks to the Google team for reports: - We now [treat](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1347) `sources` in map **as URLs** instead of file paths. - We now [resolve](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1348) `sources` **relative to map file**, not CSS file. A few source map APIs were added: - `opts.maps.absolute = true` option for [absolute paths](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1352) in source map. - `opts.maps.annotation = (file, root) => url` for a [dynamic path](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1324) to source map. - `Node#origin()` now returns `position.url` in addition to `position.file` for compatibility with absolute URLs in source map‚Äôs `sources`. #### API Changes We have added **ES modules** support and now we **export all classes** from the main entry: ```js import { CssSyntaxError, parse } from "postcss" ``` [@​graberzz](https://togithub.com/graberzz) added [`Node#source.offset`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1325) in addition to `line` and `column`. CSS Custom Properties and Sass-like `$`-variables now have a special `Declaration#variable` mark: ```js const root = parse(` :root { --propery: value; } $variable: value `) root.first.first.variable //=> true root.last.variable //=> true ``` #### TypeScript PostCSS now has a first-class TypeScript support: - We moved API docs from JSDoc to [**TypeDoc**](https://typedoc.org/). Check out our [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/). - We are using [**check-dts**](https://togithub.com/ai/check-dts) to test types with [special unit tests](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/test/errors.ts). - We keep types in separate files for better readability. - With the new structure and test system, we fixed many small issues in types. #### Other Changes - [Fixed calling `replaceWith`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1368) with input replaced node (by [@​josephkaptur](https://togithub.com/josephkaptur)). - Reduce dependencies by replacing `chalk` to [`colorette`](https://togithub.com/jorgebucaran/colorette). - Added `Declaration#value` [auto-conversion](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1373) to string to prevent plugin‚Äôs bugs. - Fixed building PostCSS with Rollup (by [@​MapGrid](https://togithub.com/MapGrid)) because of [circular dependencies](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1321). - Moved unknown source from counter to random IDs: `:10:6`. - Removed docs from the npm package. ### [`v7.0.34`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​7034) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.33...7.0.34) - Fix compatibility with `postcss-scss` 2. ### [`v7.0.33`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​7033) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.32...7.0.33) - Add error message for PostCSS 8 plugins.
--- ### Renovate configuration :date: **Schedule**: "after 10pm every weekday,before 4am every weekday,every weekend" in timezone America/Tijuana. :vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied. :recycle: **Rebasing**: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or you tick the rebase/retry checkbox. :no_bell: **Ignore**: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about these updates again. --- - [ ] If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box --- This PR has been generated by [WhiteSource Renovate](https://renovate.whitesourcesoftware.com). View repository job log [here](https://app.renovatebot.com/dashboard#github/angular/angular-cli).

Issues.Title: bug(MatRadioGroup): Cannot use a <mat-radio-group> inside a <mat-form-field>
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-czttdw
 
#### Expected Behavior

I want to be able to use a **mat-radio-group** inside a **mat-form-field**:

```
   <mat-form-field>
    <mat-radio-group formControlName="selectedValue">
        <mat-radio-button value="male">male</mat-radio-button>
        <mat-radio-button value="female">female</mat-radio-button>
    </mat-radio-group> 
  </mat-form-field>

```

In the linked StackBlitz, I have also added a **mat-select** inside a **mat-form-field**; this works correctly, and this is how I would expect **mat-radio-group** to work, too:

```
  <mat-form-field>
    <mat-label>Favorite food</mat-label>
    <mat-select formControlName="selectedValue">
      <mat-option *ngFor="let food of foods" [value]="food.value">
        {{food.viewValue}}
      </mat-option>
    </mat-select>
  </mat-form-field>
```

#### Actual Behavior

The radio buttons do not work; in the browser console this error is displayed:

> preview-29b0f46fcc27b310236ab.js:1 ERROR Error: mat-form-field must contain a MatFormFieldControl.
    at getMatFormFieldMissingControlError (form-field-errors.ts:21)
    at MatFormField._validateControlChild (form-field.ts:542)
    at MatFormField.ngAfterContentInit (form-field.ts:320)
    at callProviderLifecycles (provider.ts:563)
    at callElementProvidersLifecycles (provider.ts:542)
    at callLifecycleHooksChildrenFirst (provider.ts:530)
    at checkAndUpdateView (view.ts:376)
    at callViewAction (view.ts:626)
    at execComponentViewsAction (view.ts:570)
    at checkAndUpdateView (view.ts:381)

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.1.3
- CDK/Material: 10.2.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatRadioGroup): Cannot use a <mat-radio-group> inside a <mat-form-field>" (#20650)

Issues.Title: fix(material/select): option active styling not removed when value is changed programmatically
Issues.Body:
If an option is selected by the user and the value is changed programmatically afterwards, we weren't removing the active state from the previous option. This seems to be a regression from #19970.

These changes resolve the issue and preserve the fix from #19970 by resetting the active styling manually.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/select): option active styling not removed when value is changed programmatically" (#20649)

Issues.Title: bug(DRAG&DROP): The cdkDropList should be accessible when moving an element
Issues.Body:
I have a kanban board (like Trello) with columns that are collapsable. If a column is collapsed and I hover it when I move a card, I make it uncollaplle. However, at that point the `cdkDropListContainer` does not allow me to "drop" the card from within. 

Initially the `cdkDropList` element was "masked" with an `*ngIf` directive, I replaced it with the `hidden` attribute and then I tested with just a css style to set the size to 0 but none of these solutions worked. The result is always the same.

How is this done? How do I do it? 

I use : "@angular/cdk": "^10.0.1".

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(DRAG&DROP): The cdkDropList should be accessible when moving an element" (#20647)

Issues.Title: refactor(cdk/testing): simplify harnesses extending ContentContainerComponentHarness with a different root element
Issues.Body:
We have some test harnesses that extend `ContentContainerComponentHarness`, but have to override all methods, because their content is in a different element.

These changes clean up such usages by having a protected method for retrieving the harness root element that can be overwritten when necessary.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(cdk/testing): simplify harnesses extending ContentContainerComponentHarness with a different root element" (#20646)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-card): align in mat-card-actions can be set to 'middle' but get error "Type '"middle"' is not assignable to type '"start" | "end"'."
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction


Steps to reproduce:

Set align property of mat-card-actions to 'middle'
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Buttons are aligned in middle of view with no errors. 

#### Actual Behavior

Buttons are aligned in middle of view, but I get these errors in terminal: 

```

Issues.Title: FocusMonitor TypeError: Cannot read property 'remove' of undefined (classlist)
Issues.Body:
While using @angular/cdk ~10.2.2 and @angular/material ^10.2.2 I keep encountering the following error:
```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'remove' of undefined
    at FocusMonitor._toggleClass (a11y.js:1928)
    at FocusMonitor._setClasses (a11y.js:1957)
    at FocusMonitor.stopMonitoring (a11y.js:1897)
    at MatTooltip.ngOnDestroy (tooltip.js:249)
    at executeOnDestroys (core.js:9070)
    at cleanUpView (core.js:8992)
    at destroyViewTree (core.js:8796)
    at destroyLView (core.js:8945)
    at RootViewRef.destroy (core.js:9679)
    at ComponentRef$1.destroy (core.js:22234)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:1215)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:1165)
    at zone.js:1277
    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:407)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (core.js:27418)
    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:406)
    at Zone.runTask (zone.js:179)
    at drainMicroTaskQueue (zone.js:583)
```

The error occurs when I navigate from one page to the other. I noticed the MatTooltip class in the stacktrace, and I'd like to note that while many of the components on the page use tooltips, none were active during the time of navigation (this was instigated by a div with routerLink inside a MatMenu).
The error appears to completely break the website, leaving only a background color. Refreshing the page successfully completes the navigation. 
If any further information is needed, please let me know.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "FocusMonitor TypeError: Cannot read property 'remove' of undefined (classlist)" (#20632)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-selection-list): Check icon is not properly aligned when using zoom levels below 100% on firefox
Issues.Body:
![Missalignment at 90%](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50795659/93865057-0f619900-fcc6-11ea-8649-0c76c8036331.png)

We encountered this bug within our application (Angular 9.1.9 & Material 9.2.4) but it can easily be reproduced on the official Angular Material docs for the latest version (Angular 10.1.0 & Material 10.2.2).

#### Reproduction

Docs page where this can be reproduced: [https://material.angular.io/components/list/overview#selection-lists](https://material.angular.io/components/list/overview#selection-lists)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Visit the above linked [docs page](https://material.angular.io/components/list/overview#selection-lists) in **Firefox**
2. If not already there, scroll down to "Selection lists"-section
3. Select one or more options in the "List with selection"-example
4. Decrease zoom level (for me the misalignment is most noticable at 90%)
5. There should now be a noticeable misalignment of the check icon within the checkbox

This behaviour appears to be only present in Firefox. Chrome handles the alignment with lower zoom-levels fine.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Check icon is properly aligned in the middle of the checkbox.

#### Actual Behavior

Check icon is shifted to the top-left corner

#### Environment

- Screen Resolution: 1920x1080
- Angular: 9.1.9 & 10.1.2
- CDK/Material: 9.2.4 & 10.1.0
- Browser: Firefox 80.0.1
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-selection-list): Check icon is not properly aligned when using zoom levels below 100% on firefox" (#20630)

Issues.Title: docs(material/dialog): add documentation for MAT_DIALOG_DEFAULT_OPTIONS
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. provide MAT_DIALOG_DEFAULT_OPTIONS in the module
2. provide useValue. (ex. disableClose: true - see the following code)
{
      provide: MAT_DIALOG_DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
      useValue: <MatDialogConfig>{
        disableClose: true,
      },
    },
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Configs should be set along with the default values for the other options. Such behaviour can be seen when provided in the component with dialog.open() method
---------------------------------------------------------

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Given configs overwrite the Configs value, so that default options are also overwritten.
----------------------------------------------------------
#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
